intro: Hesperis tosyaensis, commonly known as the Tuscan Hesperis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with a distinctive appearance that resembles the traditional "four-petaled" pattern. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
